import React from 'react'; // Import the Component component from React import ProjectHeader from './../projectPage/ProjectHeader.js' import HeroImage from './../projectPage/HeroImage.js' import SectionOne from './../projectPage/SectionOne.js' import Image from './../projectPage/Image.js' import Text from './../projectPage/Text.js' import Divider from './../projectPage/Divider.js'; const data = { 'heroImage':require('./../../content/projects/pause/hero-image.png'), } const a = { 'title':'Which variables correlate with knife crime?', 'text':'Linear regression was used to understand which factors correlate with knife crime. We compared knife crime data to 32 different variables ranging from unemployment to childhood obesity. The data all came from ONS statistics, separated by borough. The R-squared value, tells us how correlated our variables are. The maximum R-squared value is 1 and the minimum is 0 and a value of greater than 0.64 is considered a strong correlation. The data suggests that boroughs with a higher prevalence of unemployment have a higher prevalence of knife crime and that boroughs with higher amounts of income support have lower levels of knife crime, suggesting that socio-economic factors play a role in the prevalence of knife crime. This model has an r-squared of 0.809.', 'image':require('./../../content/projects/bigData/1.png'), } function Pause(props) { return(
) } export default Pause;
